snippet: Iran invited young activists to Tehran for a conference on the “Islamic Awakening,” but the fact that no one from Syria’s opposition was invited disrupted the whole script.
abstract: Iran's attempt to put its own Islamic stamp on the Arab Spring by inviting thousands of young activists to Tehran for a conference on 'Islamic Awakening' backfires when organizers fail to include Syria; many participants began to chant slogan of Syrian protesters while supporters of president Bashir al-Assad drown them out with pro-Assad chants; conference underscores Iran's uneasy position amid the dramatic changes battering the Arab world.
lead_paragraph: Iran invited young activists to Tehran for a conference on the “Islamic Awakening,” but the fact that no one from Syria’s opposition was invited disrupted the whole script.

headline.main: Effort to Rebrand Arab Spring Backfires in Iran
headline.print_headline: Effort to Rebrand Arab Spring Backfires in Iran

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
